intro: Cyperus holostigma, commonly known as the narrowleaf sedges, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to parts of Asia and Africa. It belongs to the Cyperaceae family, commonly known as the sedge family, and is characterized by its grass-like appearance with triangular stems. The plant typically grows in wet or marshy environments, showcasing its adaptability to aquatic or semi-aquatic conditions. Its small, inconspicuous flowers are arranged in spikelets, which are typical of the sedge family. Cyperus holostigma is often used in wetland restoration projects due to its ability to stabilize soil and provide habitat for various organisms.
